article.title: Boron Triangular Kagome Lattice with Half-Metallic Ferromagnetism

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE based on the phase diagram of Mg-B systems on Ag(111) shown in Figure 1?
choices: The Mg1B18 allotrope is more stable than the Mg1B9 allotrope for the monolayer coverage.
The Mg1B9 allotrope consists of nine B atoms in a perfectly flat triangular network.
In the Mg1B18 allotrope, the Mg atoms are sandwiched between two B layers.
The red dashed lines in the phase diagram represent the stable states for different Mg-B systems.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding the atomic structures of B-Mg systems on Ag(111) shown in Figure 2?
choices: Figure 2a depicts the atomic structure of Mg0B12, also known as borophene.
The Mg0B24 structure in Figure 2b is composed of B20 rectified hexagonal bipyramids linked by four B atoms.
The Mg1B18 allotrope in Figure 2d exhibits a greater degree of buckling compared to the Mg1B9 allotrope.
Figure 2f illustrates the metastable configuration of a B-Mg system with the Mg atoms sandwiched between the B layer and the substrate.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded from the strain effect on the atomic structure of B9-tKL and B9-KL shown in Figure 3?
choices: The B9-tKL structure transforms into B9-KL when the angle between two large triangular units reaches 90Â°.
The bonds between the large triangular units in B9-tKL, depicted as gray lines in Figure 3a, remain intact during the transition to B9-KL.
The 2D stress experienced by the B9-tKL structure continuously increases as the biaxial strain is increased.
The B3-KL structure, shown in Figure 3c, represents a stable configuration of a 2D boron sheet.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on the data provided in Table 1, which statement accurately compares B9-tKL (zero strain) and B9-KL (18% strain)?
choices: Both B9-tKL and B9-KL exhibit the same plane group symmetry.
The Bader charge of the corner B atoms in B9-KL is higher than that in B9-tKL.
The lattice constant (a) of B9-KL is smaller than that of B9-tKL.
The Wyckoff positions of the edge B atoms are identical in both B9-tKL and B9-KL.
